versatile.sentence: The platform architecture is sufficiently versatile to accommodate diverse use cases, customization requirements, and future functionality extensions.
Organizations value versatile professionals who can contribute effectively across multiple functional areas and adapt to evolving role responsibilities.
A versatile product portfolio enables companies to serve varied customer segments and reduces dependence on single market categories or applications.
We need versatile employees who can adapt to changing roles.
This versatile tool can be used in many different situations.
Her versatile skills make her valuable to the organization.
The platform is versatile enough to meet various business needs.
Versatile thinking helps solve problems from multiple angles creatively.
The design is versatile and can be adapted easily.

viable.sentence: The business plan must demonstrate a viable path to profitability within reasonable timeframes to attract institutional investor interest and funding.
As market conditions evolve, previously viable strategies may become obsolete, requiring organizations to reassess and adapt their approaches continuously.
Identifying viable acquisition targets requires systematic screening processes that evaluate strategic fit, financial performance, and cultural compatibility.
We need to develop a viable alternative to the current approach.
The business model is financially viable and sustainable long-term.
Is this solution viable given our resource constraints and limitations?
Remote work has proven to be a viable option for teams.
The project isn't viable without additional funding and support significantly.
They're exploring viable strategies for market expansion in emerging economies.

volatile.sentence: Volatile commodity prices create earnings unpredictability for manufacturers unless they implement effective hedging strategies or pass costs through to customers.
In volatile markets, investors often reduce risk exposure by reallocating capital to defensive sectors with stable cash flows and dividend yields.
The volatile regulatory environment makes long-term strategic planning challenging as policy shifts can fundamentally alter competitive economics.
The market has been extremely volatile in recent months.
Volatile commodity prices create planning challenges for manufacturers globally.
The political situation remains volatile and uncertain currently.
Investor sentiment can be volatile in response to news.
Working in volatile markets requires flexibility and quick adaptation.
Volatile conditions make long-term forecasting difficult and unreliable.
